sentences.en: I awfully spurn this kind of teacher.
sentences.cn: 我会非常厌恶的唾弃这种烂老师.

sentences.en: One is that the syndicates will spurn smaller deals because of the cost of the paperwork.
sentences.cn: 一是,由于案头成本的问题,这些联合组织将摒弃小的投资项目.

sentences.en: She spurned all offers of help.
sentences.cn: 她骄傲地拒绝一切帮助。

sentences.en: They are treasured by localswho spurn frozen meat, finding it tasteless.
sentences.cn: 有些港人不喜寡味的冻鲜肉, 因而格外青睐这些地方.

sentences.en: They spurn all our offers of help.
sentences.cn: 他们拒绝接受我们提出的一切援助.

sentences.en: We can't spurn chances like we did in Copenhagen and against Celtic.
sentences.cn: 我们不能像在哥本哈根和哥拉斯哥那样浪费机会.

sentences.en: We should spurn at the difficulties but not look down upon them.
sentences.cn: 我们应该蔑视困难,但绝不应轻视它们.

sentences.en: With half a smile, and half a spurn.

trans.tran_en: to refuse to accept something or someone, especially because you are too proud

trans.tran_cn: 蔑视，唾弃，轻视地踏或踢

trans.tran_en: to refuse to accept something or someone, especially because you are too proud
